• Kite Suspect Reports identify customers potentially drawing against uncollected funds. Look for repeat offenders, large round dollar amounts, low ending balances, and credits and debits of similar amounts that are processed within a short window of time.
  • Large item reports identify large dollar transactions. Look for large transactions that seem unusual for the account holder, based on their expected activity or occupation.
  • Daily overdraft reports identify frequent, lengthy, increasing overdraft balances. Look for frequent overdrafts, particularly those not covered by an overdraft facility.
  • Large cash activity reports typically identify cash transactions $3,000 and greater, and can help indicate when a CTR is required. They can also identify transactions that fall just below the CTR reporting requirements that may not be typical for the account holder or business. These can also provide insights into attempts to structure transactions to fall below the CTR reporting limit required by the Bank Secrecy Act.
